Sentencas: In this study, both cathode powder preparations and fuel cell fabrications for proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells (H-SOFCs) were performed using the microwave sintering technique.
Titulo: Microwave-induced oxygen vacancy-rich surface boosts the cathode performance for proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The microwave sintering approach produced Sr2Fe1.5Mo0.25Sc0.25O6-delta (SFMS) cathode particles with a lower phase formation temperature and smaller grain size than the standard muffle furnace sintering method.
Titulo: Microwave-induced oxygen vacancy-rich surface boosts the cathode performance for proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The advantages of microwave sintering were also recognized during the fuel cell manufacturing process.
Titulo: Microwave-induced oxygen vacancy-rich surface boosts the cathode performance for proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Using the same electrolyte and anode, conventional sintering and microwave sintering were used to produce SFMS cathodes, resulting in varied fuel cell performance.
Titulo: Microwave-induced oxygen vacancy-rich surface boosts the cathode performance for proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The fuel cell output of the conventionally sintered cell was 1312 mW cm(-2) at 700 degrees C, whereas the power density of the microwave-prepared cell achieved 1452 mW cm(-2) under the same testing conditions, which was also higher than the performance of a number of recently reported H-SOFCs.
Titulo: Microwave-induced oxygen vacancy-rich surface boosts the cathode performance for proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Surface chemistry research revealed that microwave sintering generated more oxygen vacancies (Vo).
Titulo: Microwave-induced oxygen vacancy-rich surface boosts the cathode performance for proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Calculations based on first-principles indicated that the greater surface abundance of Vo increased the oxygen reduction reaction (ORR) activity.
Titulo: Microwave-induced oxygen vacancy-rich surface boosts the cathode performance for proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The benefits of microwave sintering can be discovered in both the powder preparation and cell construction stages, making it an intriguing and simple way to enhance the performance of H-SOFCs.
Titulo: Microwave-induced oxygen vacancy-rich surface boosts the cathode performance for proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells
